intro: Pfaffia aphylla, commonly known as curaçao root, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant is known for its fibrous roots, which are the primary part used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been the subject of various scientific studies.
